text: Kids run and play in a yard decorated for a little girl’s birthday. Under a HAPPY 7th BIRTHDAY DARIUS banner we see MR. & MRS. BRITT looking around for their daughter. Isola from the frolicking kids, a pair of little eyes peek thro a slot in a large cardboard box.
Grew up in New Jersey - wait, before that I guess, my parents decided to give me a black man’s name. Which was awesome.
Dad, circa 1988, smiles with unbridled excitement as he t his new house-under-construction with pregnant Mom in an upper middle class suburb.

They always said they just thought Darius sounded pretty but I think they did it to deal with guilt. Dad’s smile turns awkward when he locks eyes with one of BLACK WORKERS shoveling dirt under the brutal summer sun.
So, grew up there with them.
13 year-old DARIUS BRITT’S long dark hair whips wildly in backseat behind her parents in a convertible BMW.
They hit a really weak mid-life crisis right when I hit middle school. Again, awesome.
The BMW drives off as Darius, her hair now a wild afro, j a motley group of AWKWARD FRIENDS.
Then my mom died and we moved to New York.
Dad makes uncomfortable eye contact with a BLACK MOVER carrying a heavy ass New York Jets-themed juke box.
It stands up and walks away.
High school - whatever, then four, not five, years of college. And now, here I am.
DARIUS, 22, as pretty as a smart, funny girl can be, rega the tanned RESTAURANT MANAGER across the table from her i this gallery of forgettable birthday dinners.
Did that answer the question?
(not amused) Usually people just say where they’re from and where they worked before.
Great. I’m already overqualified.
So, in any of your previous jobs, can you tell me one instance in which you went above and beyond the call of duty for a customer? Darius lets a laugh slip out.
What would I be doing here? Fighting fires and saving lives? I thought this was for a waitress. The Manager sweeps her application into a folder.
I’m going to be honest. I’m not sure your attitude fits what we look for in customer service. Darius gives him a wide eyed look. She looks prettiest wh not on the offense.
Wait, I mean I could make something up. When I worked at Fridays I donated bone marrow once to a guy who got a Mr. Pibb instead of Coke.
You think you’re too good for this? Why are you even here?
I’m sorry. I really need the money. I work my ass off all day at an internship. I just need something to get by until I break in to the paid world.
It’s not going to work out here. I can tell your type. Difficult, bad attitude. You’re just not a quality hire.
You're a fucking Macaroni Grille manager.
Darius struggles under a Costco megapack of toilet paper.
The elevator doors press against the massive economy bund giving Darius time to squeeze into the crowded elevator.
Could someone push three? Faces and shoulders are mashed by the squishy package as tries to find a comfortable spot to stand in here. She settles, then makes eye contact with a hip, ATTRACTIVE GU
What’s up.

Darius lugs the asswipes through an office designed to lo too casual to be an office. On a wall she passes are fram covers of Facsimile Magazine, which appears to blend tech pop culture with an ironic spin into a monthly periodical  INT. FACSIMILE - BRIDGETTE’S OFFICE - DAY BRIDGETTE BAY, 34, a harshly beautiful editor with a visi hate for all women younger and/or more attractive, speaks the phone with stress and urgency. Darius leans the megapack on her desk while she fishes ch and a receipt out of her purse.
hand over phone receiver
Don’t put that there. Darius puts it on the ground.
No! Put it in the utility closet and fill all the bathrooms.
Yeah, I was just giving you this. Bridgette, annoyed, waves the money away and glares at he desk, where Darius places the change. She removes a pack tampons from a plastic bag.
I got your...stuff, too. Bridgette scowls at her. The tampons go on the table and Darius kneels to power squat the economy pack back up.
(into phone) Yeah, an intern. They need everything spelled out for them.

On her knees, Darius has to really lean and tilt her head dangerously close to the toilet bowl to get the empty pap roll unlocked. She straightens her head and frowns as she feels the wetness of her soaked hair.
Ohhhhh-kay.
The blinds are closed as the whole office is gathered to listen to pitches accompanied by slides. Bridgette stands next to a projected slide of two cowgirls kissing on a st
So the lesbian band story is in for next month. JEFF SCHWENSEN, 29, has a slight Jersey accent and looks he could be in a shirtless men’s razor commercial.
Wasn’t one of the interns in one of those female bands? Who was that? Jeff looks around and stops his eyes on Darius in the bac the room. She doesn’t like being put on the spot.
It was you, right?
Yep. Played bass. We weren’t a les- band, though. Jeff nods confusedly, sure up to now that she was a lesbi Darius fills the silence.
We were called Period Pieces. Cause of the double entendre. Now more silence.
Okay. What else do we have? Jeff looks over his notes.

What about the time traveler ad? A blown-up CLASSIFIED AD comes up on the Powerpoint scree Darius is immediately intrigued by the words that appear. WANTED: Someone to go back in time with me. This is not a joke. P.O. Box 322, Ocean View, NC 28469. You'll get paid after we get back. Must bring your own weapons. Safety no guaranteed. Some LAUGHS around the room.
So this is an ad someone e-mailed in, taken from the classifieds of a newspaper. I’m thinking kind of a funny piece about it, maybe a tongue-in-cheek investigation. (MORE )
JEFF (cont'd) Who put it up? Is it real, a prank? Come up with theories and whatnot.
You want it? It’s yours.
Can I get a couple interns for research? Darius’ eyes open. This is her chance to escape Bridgette
Me. Please. The socially awkward, prematurely balding 22 year-old nex her, ARNAU, doesn’t take his eyes off of Darius’ legs.
Me, too.
Done. INT. FACSIMILE - JEFF’S OFFICE - LATER A small office. Darius and Arnau sit across a desk from a distracted Jeff, who eyes Bridgette through a window.
We sent a letter to the address in the ad and asked them to get back to us.
And I called the local paper but they’re all uptight and won’t give out the info on the people that take out ads. Jeff leans back and runs a hand through his hair.
I fucked Bridgette.
Whoa. Arnau’s mouth freezes in the open position.
That's gross, kinda.
I know. Sometimes someone pisses you off so much you just wanna -
Did she like boss you around and criticize your technique the whole time? Bridgette makes quick eye contact with Jeff through the g
We gotta get outta here. Go to Ocean View.
We?
You don’t want to go?
I don’t know. You’re not going to fuck me, are you? Like sneak attack style.
What? No. What’s Christ, the shit rather stay here wrong with you? you say. You’d and change the toilet paper? The phone RINGS.
We'll talk about you going to the birthday? it tonight. Are thing? For Marty's
No.
Now you are. See you then.
What should I wear? Jeff eyes Arnau and picks up the phone.
An internet viewing history window is open on the left, the right window clicks through various pornographic page

My dad is sadly at the point where he’s technologically sophisticated enough to find specialized niche internet porn but doesn’t know how to clear the browsing history. After a slew of teen-themed sites a couple preggo’s go by

This is worse than watching beheading videos. Why do I do this?

I know. You would know how to cover your tracks, with all that experience you guys have scamming Americans on the internet from Algeria or Nigeria or wherever you're from. Farid shakes his head patiently.
Don’t play dumb, I watch Dateline. Darius’ father, MR. BRITT, 50, enters the room.
Dary, after dinner see if you can figure out why the computer’s been so slow. Videos take forever. Darius nods, blank faced.
Hey Farid, would one of those little mini laptops help out with your schoolwork?
No, Mr. Britt. You’ve been too generous, sir. Please.
Darius eyes her father across the table. Farid happily ea
Can I take the car? I’m going out.
Out out?
It’s just this work thing.
That’s great, Dary. You should be going out more. It’ll help you out of your funk.
I have no funk. Totally funkless.
Something is wrong with you, honey. But getting out there, being social, it’1ll make you feel better.
This is, this is - okay, what? What is wrong with me?
You're sad. I don’t know how to describe it. There’s a cloud around you. You’re very antisocial. And you're a virgin.
What.
What?
Honey, even in my day twenty-one was pretty old to be a virgin.
Oh my god, how do I eject? What makes you think? How would you even know?  10.
Who would it be? I don’t think I’ve ever seen you with a guy.
How do you know I’m not on Craigslist having casual encounters, F-4-M’ing it up out there? Or when I lived away in the dorms?
I talked to Amy.
Why are you talking to my college roommate?
We're friends on Facebook.
Ew. This is too much. I’m done. But I’m staying to finish because I’m hungry. Darius silently eats her dinner. Mr. Britt pats Farid’s b
You gettin’ enough, Farid? Let me grab you another steak.

A corner booth at a loud dance club. Darius and Arnau are sandwiched between Jeff and ERIC and JON, two 25 year-old guys who spot each other at the gym and take care to avoi wearing the same Ed Hardy T-shirt when they go out. They listen to Jeff in awe.

Dude, it was fucking insane. I knew from her friend that she had herpes but I wasn’t supposed to know, her friend swore me not to say she told me, so I was in the fucking room with this girl all night trying to make up reasons why I didn’t want to fuck her.
Why didn’t you just get the fuck out of there?  11.
She was fucking naked and looked super hot. It was a fucking quandary.
What’d you tell her?

I was saying all this shit like I didn’t want to rush into anything and get hurt. Meanwhile she’s like, “I want you to fuck my ass.” And I'm like, you're the kind of girl I might fall in love with, let’s take it slow. The two dudes laugh hard. Darius observes like she’s on a disgusting safari.
So excuse me for interrupting but were we supposed to talk about the story?
Hold on, I’m gonna get a drink. Talk to my buddy, Eric. Eric eyes Darius aggressively as he shouts to Jeff.
Dude, your intern is sort of hot.

Jon gets nasty on the dance floor, grinding obscenely wit CHICK in a too-short skirt. Darius ricochets her eyes away from the scene, still seat at the table. Eric brings her a drink. She watches his primitive grin as he takes in the debauchery on the dance floor. He turns his focus back to her.
So do you watch Family Guy?
Yeah.
That shit is hilarious. Darius nods. He nods.  12.
So fucking funny. He stares at her tits. She leans over to Jeff.
I’m gonna go home, since this is pointless.
What? Alright. Get ready for a ten hour drive to Ocean View tomorrow. Darius sits up and leans forward.
I want a shared credit. Let me help write it. I need a break. Please?
You're just hitting me up now cause I’m drunk.
Yep.
We'll see what you write. If it’s good I can get you in the by line. Darius lights up a bit and stands up.
Alright. That’s all I came for.
It’s so early. Eric slides in front of Darius and speaks in a confident, practiced tone.
It would make me really happy if you would not let this night end and let me buy you one more drink.
No thanks. He takes her hand, causing her to frown.
You’re gonna make me unhappy? I’11 be thinking about you all night.  13. Darius, confused, looks to Jeff.
Is this normal? What’s he doing? Eric takes her hand and places it on his chest.
Can’t you feel what you do to me? What you do to my heart?
Oh my God, are you serious? He just flexed his chest. Darius removes her hand and gets up to leave.
Aww! Why you gonna do that to me? (points at Jon) Dude! Taco Bell! Let’s go! Right now! Darius hurries away.

Darius escapes through the front door with a packed trave bag in the groggy, dim pre-morning hour. INT. ARNAU’S HOUSE - MORNING Arnau plays a massively multiplayer online game set in th pirate world. He jams his swarthy pirate into some game glitch that results in the character jittering up and dow repetitively while an endless shower of experience points gold rains down into his cache. Arnau checks his watch, leaves the game on, and takes off

Arnau’s pixel pirate, still in seizure, is approached by fat pirate and a chat box appears: WIF U DOING? The fat pirate waits for a moment, then casually stabs th jittering pirate with a sword, dropping him dead.
Darius and Arnau get into Jeff's Acura.  14.
Bridgette approaches Jeff's office with two cups of coffe hand. She slows as she passes, sees it empty through the glass, then keeps walking.
Jeff's car cruises the interstate in a dense, urban area.
The backdrop has turned rural. Trees beginning to shed fo fall race past.
We're budgeted for two rooms, but if we all share one we can use the extra money for other shit.
Coke and hookers? Meth, actually. Probably more of a meth town.
Exactly. Arnau fidgets. Jeff eyes him in the rear-view.
Arnau. Easy. We’re just fucking around. We can spend it on buffets and shit. You never do coke or anything when you’re studying for a test?
Cocaine? Are you crazy?
You're obviously not serious about your schoolwork.
What are you studying?
Biological and life sciences.
What the fuck are you interning at a magazine for?
The diversity looks good on applications for grad school.
Alright we need to get you laid on this vacation is what needs to happen.
Vacation?
Work trip, whatever. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - LATE AFTERNOON Darius looks out the window as Jeff drives, sun

Passing images. -- Sign reads “Beaches 5 Miles.” 15. going down. -- Bridges connect a marshy mainland to the island beach -- A seafood restaurant with a giant crab on the roof. -- A place called Shell World. -- Freezing TEENS run in soaked shirts across the street. -- A sign reads “Ocean View.” We get a good look at Ocean View. Nobody on the on the beach. The summer’s as faded as the last day’s sunlight here. The town feels lonely. Too late in September.

Ughh. It’s freezing here. Jeff, his shirt whipping in the wind, turns. the gray a hoodie.  16.
It’s got a bite, don’t it?
It makes my stomach hurt. Reminds me of when it was time to go back to school.
Now it’s all just one long school year. No end and no start. Except for this guy. Arnau joins them.
How many more years of school you got left, Arnau?
Total including doctorate or just undergraduate?
Aw, forget it.
Darius, Jeff and Arnau lug their bags into the outdated r Turquoise bed spreads and pink seashell lamps clash with panel wallpaper. Arnau squints at the Zenith TV set.
This is like the TV at my grandmother’s house. Darius drops her bags and looks at the two queen beds.
How're we doing the beds?
Interns in one. Me in the other.
No. Alright I guess.
Fine. Me and Darius. Darius shoots him daggers.
Fine. Get ready, Arnau, I cuddle.  17. Jeff tosses his duffel bag on the bed.
Tomorrow morning we jam it at the post office. Hopefully this guy checks his PO box every day.
We pull out as an OLDTIMER, 70’s, enters frame and moves toward the box.
Here we go.

(reading) Wanted: Someone to go back in time with me. This is not a joke. P.O. Box 322, Ocean View, NC 28469. You'll get paid after we get back. Must bring your own weapons. Safety not guaranteed.
There are no Starbucks here yet. Crazy. They turn their heads as Jeff approaches with plain white cups of coffee and passes them out. Jeff waits one beat.
God this is boring as shit.
It’s kind of cool.

Our dedicated leader.

The economy isn’t a fixed thing. People think because that’s how it is now then that’s how it’ll always be, but they’re just looking at this narrow band of time when if you look at the big picture the distribution of wealth has been steadily spreading out from aristocratic society to slave economy to industrial and on and on in both directions.
I gotta do a bathroom check, brother. To be continued.

Yeah, okay. It’s just amazing how they can get these people to vote against their economic interests. Like it or not it’s historically headed in one direction, they're just delaying the inevitable. She was like the local chick I used to hang out with when my family came here. Summer lovin’. Fuck she was so tan and hot. And her hair was always bleached white from the sun. Man, if there’s one girl I always wondered about it’s her. Darius approaches from behind.

eat burgers at the bar.
